title: Ander Herrera hails Jose Mourinho for improving Manchester United standards - 'he only wants the best'
text:
Herrera speaks to Jose Mourinho (Photo: Reuters) Share Get   Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Ander Herrera believes Jose Mourinho's determination to make Manchester United the best has been key to their recent winning run. 
The Red Devils have won their last seven matches in all competitions and are now just two points off the top four. 
Herrera has been excellent in recent weeks and continues to shine in a midfield trio with Michael Carrick and Paul Pogba. 
And the Spaniard has revealed how the United boss has turned things around since Louis van Gaal's departure, reports the Manchester Evening News. 
"He wants to be the best and he wants us to be the best. He is not happy with good things, he wants the best things and I think he goes very good with the history of this club," he told Premier League TV. Herrera in action against West Ham (Photo: Reuters) Manchester United have won their last seven (Photo: Tom Purslow) 
"He knows how to treat the players, he knows when he has to push you and when he has to relax. 
"He has given me a new role, you have all seen that, I am more defensive than with other managers, now I am better organised defensively when we lose the ball against the opposition, but he is playing me sometimes more forward and I am improving at that because he has put everything to help me and teach me. 
"He's a winning manager, he has shown that all his career and he is at the perfect place at the biggest club in England and one of the most successful clubs in the world, so we are lucky to have him and I think he is very happy with the squad and the way we are working for him." poll loading Will Manchester United get into the top four this season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
